title: RAB7L1
text:
RAB7, member RAS oncogene family-like 1 is a <a href="protein">protein</a> that in humans is encoded by the "RAB7L1" <a href="gene">gene</a>. The gene is also known as "RAB7L". RAB7L1 encodes a small <a href="GTP-binding%20protein">GTP-binding protein</a> and is a member of the <a href="Ras%20superfamily">Ras superfamily</a>.
Model organisms.
<a href="Model%20organism">Model organism</a>s have been used in the study of RAB7L1 function. A conditional <a href="knockout%20mouse">knockout mouse</a> line, called "Rab7l1tm1a(EUCOMM)Wtsi" was generated as part of the <a href="International%20Knockout%20Mouse%20Consortium">International Knockout Mouse Consortium</a> program — a high-throughput mutagenesis project to generate and distribute animal models of disease to interested scientists — at the <a href="Wellcome%20Trust%20Sanger%20Institute">Wellcome Trust Sanger Institute</a>.
Male and female animals underwent a standardized <a href="phenotypic%20screen">phenotypic screen</a> to determine the effects of deletion. Twenty one tests were carried out on <a href="mutant">mutant</a> mice, but no significant abnormalities were observed.
